subject: Art
title: Hex Codes
description: The six-digit code that precisely identifies any digital color.

hook.text: #FF5733 ‚Äî that's not a phone number or a password. It's a color: a vivid orange-red. Hex codes are the universal language for digital color.

buildup.text: A hex code is a 6-digit representation of RGB values. The first two digits = red, middle two = green, last two = blue. Each pair ranges from 00 (none) to FF (maximum, which is 255 in decimal).

discovery.text: #FF0000 is pure red. #00FF00 is pure green. #0000FF is pure blue. #FFFFFF is white. #000000 is black. #808080 is middle gray. Once you learn the pattern, you can read hex at a glance.

twist.text: CSS, HTML, design tools, and brand guidelines all use hex codes. Knowing them means you can communicate color precisely ‚Äî no more 'kind of a teal-ish blue.'

climax.text: Quick decode: #FFD700. FF = max red, D7 = high green, 00 = no blue. High red + high green + no blue = gold. You can now read hex codes like a pro.

punchline.text: Six characters, 16.7 million colors. Hex codes are color's fingerprint.
